title: Technology Integration Strategies for Workplace Training: A Universal Design for Learning (UDL)-Based Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced theoretical knowledge and mastery of high-level application skills
context.additional_context: A course designed for university students to understand technology-enabled learning in workplace settings and participate in training design applying UDL principles. Providing flexible learning experiences combining online and offline activities

learning_goals: Learners can explain strategies for effectively utilizing three or more technical tools (e.g., collaboration platforms, virtual simulations) in workplace training.
Learners can design technology-based training modules by applying the engagement principles of UDL (interest stimulation, effort adjustment, self-regulation).
Learners can analyze and propose customized technology utilization cases (e.g., gamification, AR/VR content) considering diverse learner types.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
